eventName: Once Upon a Time, I Wandered Afar
storyName: Once Upon a Time, I Wandered Afar
storyInfo: An old tree is replanted at the smith's workshop, and soldiers and warriors gather for a celebratory banquet. After the feast, an old veteran soon-to-retire finally finds the courage to say farewell to the Grandmaster he has long admired.

attributes.content: Keep going. You have only a few more shovel loads to go.
And you'll merely stand and watch?
As the saying goes, 'be a passive observer.' I'd love to help you, but I'm sure you remember how my arm got hurt?
Very well...
General, I have the wine you requested.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: What took you so long?
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: The locals are all celebrating the news of our victory. A number of inns are booked out, and every last one is short on staff. The streets are lined with their delivery burdenbeasts.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: I had to work as a waiter for half a day and then help them unload their wares before I could make it back.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: In addition to fighting gallantly on the battlefield, a Yumen soldier must always be prepared to help the local citizens. Fine work.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: Thank you, General.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Let me see.
'Knife-Edge,' 'Five Bowls,' 'Bridges Ne'er Crossed'... Hmm...? And a jar of Husong from Jiangnan.
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: Master Zuo, you mustn't use official business as an excuse to let these fine wines go to waste again.
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: ...Naturally.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: Greetings, Grandmaster.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Good work, Brother Dajiang.
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: I-I simply did what I should've.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: The officer stops pushing the cart loaded with wine and lifts his head to scan the courtyard in front of him.

Chengnan Bladesmiths, the most reputable bladesmiths in Yumen. The Patrol Battalion contracted them to produce much of their military equipment. Its owner, Meng Tieyi, is also a good friend of both the Lord Exorcist and the Grandmaster.
On days when they are off duty from the garrison, they often gather at the workshop with warriors from all over to spar, drink, and share stories.
He, too, comes every now and then, but something is different about the courtyard here today—

A few dozen bricks by the gate have been removed, and a old pagoda tree has been planted in the resulting pit. With its branches extending in all directions, it has taken up a considerable amount of space in the courtyard.
The tree's trunk is as wide as two lovers sharing an embrace. The grooves on its bark are lightly covered in small grains of sand, and coarse like an old man's palm.
Look at this old pagoda tree. It must be at least a hundred years old, yet it was so hastily replanted in this nomadic city. Who can even say whether it will manage to adjust to the climate here?
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: Surely it's better than your habit of carving your achievements into it like the warriors of old, is it not? The worst thing you can do an old tree is harm its bark. If we'd left it there in the sands, it could very well have withered away.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: True enough...
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: It was our heroine who came up with the idea of bringing it here. I can already picture her throwing a fit, once she arrives and catches you harping on about that.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: Besides, a tree is not much different from a man. Having survived in the desert for so long, we mustn't underestimate its vigor.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: And with Tieyi taking care of it, no doubt we'll have a whole tree's worth of new leaves to shade ourselves under by this time next year.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: You're right about that.
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: All of you just love giving me more work to do, don't you?
I should never have let you bring that tree... All the sunlight glaring down on me here must've stolen my wits.
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: There are nothing but forges and weapons here. Adding a touch of life isn't such a bad idea, is it?
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: Forget it. There's no arguing with any of you.
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: Oh? The wine is here? Perfect. The food is ready too. The tree's been planted, yes? Come on, let's head inside!
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: Then I shall be taking my leave, General, Grandmaster, Master Meng. Please excuse me.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Why in such a hurry?
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: Because this is a gathering for gentlemen of your stature...
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Your General Zuo has yet to award you for your achievements. He wouldn't have had you purchase his alcohol without intending to let you join in on the celebration.
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: ...The Grandmaster is right.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: Okay....
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Then I'll carry the wine in for now.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Huh...?
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: How could the moons in the sky be so much higher than the pagoda tree? How bizarre.
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: Tieyi, you've had too much to drink. Your eyes are deceiving you.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: Had too much to drink?
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: No, no, no. The night is still young. Why do you think I always set aside some wine when I forge my blades? A single gulp can increase the strength of my hammer strikes threefold!
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: Lord Exorcist, as the general of the Yumen army, no one here can best you when it comes to leading an army, but when it comes to alcohol and kung fu... hoh...
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: Oh really now? Keep going. What was that about my kung fu?
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: Was I not at the very front line when we pursued the bandits into the desert? Both the enemies I've vanquished and the scars on my body may well outnumber yours!
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: Look at my left arm. This injury. Just half a cun deeper, and it would've cut into my meridians.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: Stop rolling up your sleeves, Lord Exorcist. Perhaps you should have a look at the wound on my back. Which I took for you, need I remind you!
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: What time is it?
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: It is the Hour of Tzu, Grandmaster.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: The workshop's main room is packed with people, and there are a number of tables between the officer and the Grandmaster. He raises his voice, but has no way of knowing whether it has been heard.
The floor is lined with rows and rows of empty jugs, and the more there are, the rowdier the crowd gets.

A drunken, loud-mouthed arena champion and a Yumen general injured in a bout against a practitioner of the martial arts... The officer tries to recall how they looked on the battlefield earlier in the day, only to be reminded of how inebriated he is.
Why ask the time? Are you drunk?
attributes.name: Clear Voice

attributes.content: Your alcohol tolerance is no match for that sister of yours.
attributes.name: Clear Voice

attributes.content: The voice is melodious and crystal clear, yet the words it carries cannot be more casual.

The officer can tell it belongs to the heroine who often sits by the Grandmaster's side. He has no idea when she joined the celebrations. She is sitting opposite the Grandmaster this time, so he can only see her from behind.

No one knows what she came to Yumen for. All they know is that she is on very friendly terms with the Grandmaster, the Lord Exorcist, and Master Meng. Supposedly, she and the Grandmaster had a friendly bout together—it takes a fight to truly know one another, or so it is often claimed—and stayed afterwards.

All his brothers on the squad have sparred with her. They usually have nothing but good things to say about her, too. Her swordsmanship, her alcohol tolerance, her carefree and straightforward personality, and just how likeable she is overall.
But as luck would have it, he has never even gotten to see what she looks like.
He finds himself curious and stands up, but the armed escort sitting next to him notices his empty bowl and fills it with wine.
You mean Ling? Ah, yes, the two of you met the last time she ventured here.
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: She is always awake within her dreams and befuddled without. Drunk or not, it matters to her not one whit.
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: Look at you rambling again. So you really are drunk.
attributes.name: Heroine

attributes.content: We lost quite a few men to this battle, and just about everyone who made it back is injured in some way.
attributes.name: Heroine

attributes.content: Right.
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: There's a question I've been meaning to ask you.
attributes.name: Heroine

attributes.content: To go a hundred battles without suffering a single wound, you must be far, far too good at kung fu.
attributes.name: Heroine

attributes.content: And your name too—'Shuo.' What does it mean? Who has a single word for their name, anyway? Rather than a person's name, it sounds more like an alias.
attributes.name: Heroine

attributes.content: Another baby sister of mine gave it to me.
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: I've heard of names given by parents, by elders, by teachers, and even by fortune tellers... but by your sister? And younger, at that? That hardly makes any sense.
attributes.name: Heroine

attributes.content: That's just how things are between us siblings... It's a long story.
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: Look at you, Grandmaster. You've had too much to drink.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: And now you're helping him dodge the question...
attributes.name: Heroine

attributes.content: You know what? Never mind.
attributes.name: Heroine

attributes.content: In that case...
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: Would any of you care to grant me a proper name, befitting a person?
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: Grandmaster?
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: General Zuo, given the celebratory mood, wouldn't you agree there is no better time?
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: Very well then!
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: Ever since the Yumen Arena Board of Fame was established, the top of the list has been left blank. The whole city knows whose name goes there, and even I, second place on the list, can't last ten moves against you.
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: Your kung fu is unparalleled. How about we name you 'Wudi,' the 'Invulnerable'?
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: Listen to yourself. Does that sound like a proper name to you?
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: If we must give him a name, it has to be 'Dinglan,' meaning 'smooth tides.' Representing the peace and tranquility he has brought our citizens.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: Or perhaps 'Ancang,' 'tranquil blue.'
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: What is this, a poetry club? I can barely make sense of either of them.
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: Let's call him 'Qianjun.' Remember the moves he showed us last time? When his fist landed on me, it felt like it weighed a thousand tons.
attributes.name: Red-faced Armed Escort

attributes.content: No, it should be 'Qingyan,' for 'clear skies.'
attributes.name: Red-eared Staff Officer

attributes.content: They frown. The Lord Exorcist, the workshop owner... everyone in attendance frowns at once.
The men's gazes all land on him. Halfway done with his cup of wine, the officer sets it down.
Grandmaster...
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Brother Dajiang, do you perhaps have a suggestion?
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: Where I'm from, we name our children after whatever our eyes happen to land on.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: I never had an education. I... I can't help you much here...
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Oh, shut up, all of you.
attributes.name: Heroine

attributes.content: I can't believe you're all racking your brains over this. Let me think.
attributes.name: Heroine

attributes.content: The tall, slender lady stands up. She raises her bowl of wine and walks past the rows of empty jugs and arguing guests.
She opens the window, filling the entire room with the night breeze and silencing the attendees' chatter.

The twin moons hang high in the sky. The night is no longer young, but Yumen, the nomadic fortress, never sleeps. In its non-residential districts, the Originium lampposts keep the streets illuminated throughout the night, ensuring visibility at all times of day.
In the distance lies a chain of mountains, comfortably asleep. They look as though someone above the clouds had raised their hand and flung down blobs of thick ink.
What those mountains look like is in the eye of the beholder, but they've always been there. Anyone can see them just by looking up.
attributes.name: Heroine

attributes.content: How about 'Chongyue'?
attributes.name: Heroine

attributes.content: 'Chongyue.'

The officer mouths the two syllables a couple of times. He has no idea what they mean, but they certainly sound imposing. It is definitely a far better name than the others that have been proposed so far.
He steals a glance at the Grandmaster, who sits not too far away. The man's expression has not changed, but while not overjoyed, his eyes have a glow to them that was not there a few moments ago.
He recalls how a decade or so ago, on the day he was first transferred to Yumen, the Grandmaster made an exception and paid the arena a visit.
Almost all the newly enlisted men had heard of the legendary Grandmaster, and he certainly did not betray their eager gazes.
Thousands of days and nights have come and gone across countless battlefields. Not once has Yumen's march through the sands come to a halt. Ten years have passed by in the blink of an eye.
He knows the Grandmaster's eyes. They never exert power nor radiance. More often, they are calm, with an unfamiliar-yet-comforting aura to those around him.

attributes.text: The Grandmaster has always been here, but does he truly belong here?
Right now, he has that look in his eyes again, but they also seem somewhat different than usual.
Is it the night breeze? Did the wind blow away the sand in his eyes? Or was the wine he bought today really so potent?
...Can someone really become so emotional over receiving a new name?

attributes.content: 'Chongyue.'
attributes.name: Shuo

attributes.content: 'Chongyue.' Perfect! A towering yet stable mountain, that stops the sands below and blocks the clouds above. Literary, yet rolls off the tongue well. As expected of our heroine.
attributes.name: Red-eared Staff Officer

attributes.content: Hmph... Pipe down... Since when did she need your help explaining the meaning?
attributes.name: Red-faced Armed Escort

attributes.content: What a great name. It really captures the Grandmaster's dignified image.
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: I propose another toast to this fine name.
attributes.name: Meng Tieyi

attributes.content: To Chongyue!
attributes.name: Half-Drunken Attendees

attributes.content: Thank you, everyone.
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: The workshop was closed yesterday, and the owner also forgot to keep the forge fires burning. The morning breeze sweeps through the courtyard and lands on the officer's face, immediately waking him from his wine-induced slumber.

His head still hurts, and all he remembers is how they had all raised their wine bowls to celebrate the Grandmaster's new name. Before long, one of the inebriated attendees began to sing a folk song from the barracks, and he teared up after a while.
My eyes aren't tricking me, are they...?
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: It had only been a single night, but the old pagoda tree no longer feels out of place. Rather, it is the man standing underneath it whom the officer is surprised to see.
He tries to sneak away, only for the man to hear him.
Good morning. You have the day off, if I recall. Why not rest a while longer?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: I'm used to getting up around this time... and I had too much to drink. I couldn't sleep well.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: This campaign has lasted year after year, and all of you have played no small part in its ongoing success.
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: Then why are you awake this early, Grandmaster? Or have you stayed up all night?
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: My apologies. There were too many people around last night. I wasn't able to offer you a toast. I just feel that... I really need to properly thank you.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Thank me?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: You saved me! During our last battle a few days ago!
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: I was so focused on the bandit in front of me, I didn't notice the blade coming at me from behind. You fended it off for me.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: If it weren't for you, even if I'd achieved enough to be granted a promotion, it would only have been for dying gloriously in battle.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: I'm sure... you don't even remember.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: If it were at all possible, I would defend every last one of my allies, but... the battlefield is a merciless place. There are too many variables, and it is something even I can only dream of achieving.
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: Grandmaster, all of us were prepared when we enlisted and came to Yumen. Of course I'm afraid of dying, but I'm not that afraid of dying.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Are you not alive and well right now?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: As long as you still live, you must treasure your life. Be sure to live until the day you get to return home and be with your family.
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: I won't hide it from you... it's too late for that. I'm about to leave Yumen.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Are you being reassigned elsewhere?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: No, that's not it...
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Thanks to you, I survived our last battle, but the injury I had before has been acting up a lot these past six months. The doctor told me my meridians will never heal up completely. This hand of mine won't be able to hold a blade for much longer.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: General Zuo has been very understanding. He's already given me permission to leave the army early. Once I'm finished packing, I'll be able to head home. I'll probably be gone by the end of the month.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: My old mother is still waiting for me, and I don't have any siblings. I've been in the army for over a decade, and I've never had the chance to go home and care for her, not even for a day.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: How could this be...?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: It's nothing, really. Even if I won't be able to hold a sword, I can still plow the fields with a hoe.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: The court is kind to us soldiers too. After I retire, I'll still have the same benefits as a centurion.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: ...Grandmaster, I hope you won't mind me speaking my mind.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: When I found out I couldn't serve anymore... I really wasn't sure if I was ready to leave you, General Zuo, Yumen, and all my brothers behind... and I mean this from the bottom of my heart.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: I know we used to yell 'the yellow sands will bury us all together,' but I actually felt a little fortunate when I realized I could go home alive...
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: And lately, I can't shake this thought either... Suppose I die on the battlefield. Even if my mother gets compensated for my death, how is she supposed to live out the rest of her life on her own?
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Do you perhaps... consider me a deserter?
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Why would you think so?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: Your injury is definitive proof that you have defended your homeland for years. What could give anyone the right to criticize you?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: And even in plowing the fields back home, you will still be serving our country by producing food.
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: A single leaf falls from the old pagoda tree. Having been replanted here from a hundred li away, even though the tree is now in a far superior environment, it has naturally yet to become accustomed to its surroundings.
The two men's lingering tipsiness draws them closer to one another. The officer glances at the man standing next to him.

He is the kind of man heard of only in legends, the kind of man one can only dream of laying their eyes on. Yet the man who stands beside him right now feels like nothing more than an approachable older brother.
I... I still have another question, but... I'm afraid to ask.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: You and I risked our lives together. That makes us comrades. We may have different responsibilities that have thus far given us few chances to share a conversation, but that is no reason for us to be estranged.
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: Haha... Hearing that from you makes me feel like all those risks I took were worth it.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Grandmaster, why do you guard Yumen?
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Is it not for the same reason as any other soldier?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: But you are not like us, and not quite like General Zuo, either...
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: When I first arrived, the old veterans told me you'd already been guarding Yumen for a long time, but now I'm an old veteran myself, while you look just the same as all those years ago.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Everyone calls you the Grandmaster, but no one seems to know what your actual position is... We risk our lives together, but the court never seems to award you for any of your achievements.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: You have no family... and the heroine has been here in Yumen for so long too...
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: Or perhaps it's because you have no equal under all of heaven, and the blades and arrows of the battlefield mean nothing to you, that you have no worries at all...
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: The man's eyes suddenly sharpen. It is at this moment that the officer realizes that he said something he should not have. His lingering tipsiness vanishes without a trace.
M-My apologies! I... I shouldn't have said that.
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: No, you are right.
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: It is true. I am different from the rest of you. That is nothing to hide, nor could I hide it were I to try.
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: Right...
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: But even if I am, what difference does it make?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: These yellow sands are vast and harrowing, but this is Great Yan's wall, behind which are our loved ones.
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: Countless soldiers guard this place, suffer countless hardships, and brave countless deaths, but certainly they do it for more than honor and wealth.
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: Have all of you asked yourselves, 'Why do we stay here to defend this place?'
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: Is the answer really so important?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: We may not necessarily be so different.
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: Besides, as you well know, I now have a name just like any of yours, don't I?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: Is this a good time?
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: Please, go ahead. Is something the matter?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: It's important.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: General Zuo, Grandmaster, I will be heading back to the barracks now!
attributes.name: Centurion

attributes.content: The Messenger from the capital arrived last night. You're being summoned back for debriefing.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: With the situation here stable as of late, the court might perhaps have other arrangements for you.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: But hardly any time has passed this time?
attributes.name: Chongyue

attributes.content: To the Sui Regulator, your current stay in Yumen has been long enough.
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: The Messenger handed me the letter directly. It seems aside from the Sui Regulator, the Ministry of War has also put on quite a bit of pressure...
attributes.name: Zuo Xuanliao

attributes.content: The officer leaves the smithy and closes the door behind him. The conversation in the garden gradually fades away.
The conversation he just had with the man now feels almost unreal.
He tightens his armor and grips his aching arm.
The breeze that morning feels awfully cold.
Half a month later
Brother Dajiang, these two jugs of wine are on me. I'll put them in your cart. Drink them on your way home.
attributes.name: Roadside Inn Staff

attributes.content: Take it easy when you steer the burdenbeasts. Don't break the jugs.
attributes.name: Roadside Inn Staff

attributes.content: I can't accept these. You've already given me so much.
attributes.name: Retired Soldier

attributes.content: Nonsense. We've fought side by side, and now this is where you draw the line?
attributes.name: Roadside Inn Staff

attributes.content: So, you're going home, and you no longer see me as a brother in arms?
attributes.name: Roadside Inn Staff

attributes.content: Of course I still do.
attributes.name: Retired Soldier

attributes.content: Come to think of it, though, I'm really not used to seeing you in that get-up.
attributes.name: Roadside Inn Staff

attributes.content: I don't look nearly as impressive without my uniform, right? It's been years now. I'm still nowhere near retirement age, but you age fast in the military.
attributes.name: Retired Soldier

attributes.content: Oh, stop complaining. Live a peaceful life as soon as you get home. Make sure to write us once you get married and start pumping out kids. We'd love to hear all about that.
attributes.name: Roadside Inn Staff

attributes.content: And come back if you ever have the chance. I'll treat you to another round.
attributes.name: Roadside Inn Staff

attributes.content: I will.
attributes.name: Retired Soldier

attributes.content: Take care.
attributes.name: Retired Soldier

attributes.content: You too.
attributes.name: Roadside Inn Staff

attributes.content: What a coincidence, though. The Grandmaster is leaving today, too.
attributes.name: Roadside Inn Staff

attributes.content: I'll think of this as me sending the both of you off.
attributes.name: Roadside Inn Staff

attributes.content: By the way, do you know where he's heading this time?
attributes.name: Roadside Inn Staff

attributes.content: *sigh*...
attributes.name: Roadside Inn Staff

attributes.content: I'll be off now.
attributes.name: Retired Soldier

attributes.content: The sands of time sweep all feelings away.
All return home but one knows not where to stay.
